data.title: Integer Overflow when using actors with AttackGarrisoned Trait.
data.body:
I can't really say much about what caused this bug, the mod has a defence structure and a vehicle that use AttackGarrisoned, obviously one of both must have been used when the crash happened, I didn't had the luck to see it. @penev92 has some ideas of what might have caused it.
The Spanish text says, the negation of the minimal value of two complementary numbers is not valid.

```

data.title: Small code cleanup in the Passenger trait
data.body: Moved some code around.

data.title: Fix the TargetTypes of the Mad Tank
data.body:
"Vehicle" was missing, which lead to tanya shooting at it.
Tanya's weapon (Colt45) has InvalidTargets: Vehicle defined,
so adding just "Vehicle" to the TargetTypes fixed the bug.

Fixes #10545.

data.title: Tanya shoots at MAD tank - RA 12-24-2016
data.body: Small bug, it is cool hearing her shoot though.

data.title: release-20151224 / OS X not starting
data.body:
On OS X, in the following environment:
- OS X El Captain (10.11.2)
- Mono for Mac OS X Universal (4.2.1.102)

The game is not starting _at all_. Looking at `top`, the `launchgame` process utilizes 100% of the CPU without any sign of progress. Meanwhile, the UI is completely frozen.

data.title: Restart skirmish matches
data.body:
This allows one to return to the skirmish lobby with the same settings and bots as one had in a previous match. Tested while in the middle of a match with another bot, could go back to lobby and then hit start again with no problems and all settings and bots stayed the same

Should handle the skirmish part of #10533

data.title: General Cleanup
data.body:
Run automated fixes from VS to simplify names, remove unused usings and remove redundant casts.

I have made inline comments against minor tweaks where I intervened - fixes are otherwise automated so should be pretty safe to take despite the diff size.

data.title: Unhardcode ChronoShift palettes and sequences
data.body: This exposes them to lint testing and modder configuration. Required for https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/pull/52 since https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8176.

data.body:
> schrlo1.wav, schrlo2a.wav schrlo2b.wav, schrlo2c.wav, schrlo3.wav

results in

```
Failed to parse WAV file schrlo1.wav. Error message:

data.title: PLEASE DON'T POST HERE
data.body: Wrong tracker, trying to redirect the people at https://github.com/Phrohdoh/OpenRA/issues/87.

data.title: Fix filename case on weapon reports.
data.body: Fixes the RA and TD mods in preparation for #10535.

data.title: Move OpenRA.Traits.Util to Mods.Common
data.body:
Moves some code around in preparation for fixing #4823.

Depends on #10521.  Only the last four commits are part of this PR.

data.title: Added a warning when bots have been disabled
data.body: If people click skirmish and choose an island map, they get a wrong illusion that we don't support AI. See https://www.facebook.com/openra/posts/993082560747961?comment_id=993237267399157&comment_tracking=%7B%22tn%22%3A%22R0%22%7D

data.title: Auto-detect mix hash type.
data.body:
This rewrites the mix file parser to be guess whether it is uses classic or CRC style hashes, and removes the last direct workarounds for mix file uglyness from the rest of the engine.

This can impact/regress mods in two ways:
1. A valid local and/or global mix database containing the filenames is now required to load files from the package.  This shouldn't be a problem unless somebody went out of their way to make their mix files unusable by XCC mixer.
2.  Filenames inside mixes are now case sensitive, and must be queried using the exact case written in the local or global mix database (usually all lower case).

I've tested that TD/RA/TS still successfully install from CD (except for #10529) and can launch a skirmish.

data.title: Z sorting issues with barrels
data.body:
Applies to both voxel and sprite barrels.

Basically, they are sorted either below or above the turret (depending on the ZOffset), but the Z sorting seems to be (no longer?) facing-dependent. For example, in TS the Titan's barrel is now always drawn 'behind' the turret, even when facing east. Increasing the ZOffset would simply have the opposite effect and make it clip through the turret when facing west.

I have the same problem in my MechCommander mod with sprite barrels.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29936979-z-sorting-issues-with-barrels?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: RFE: Persistent Skirmish/multiplayer game options and ability to restart with said options
data.body:
I'd like to be able to restart a game when in Skirmish or multiplayer modes while kepeing the same game options.

When initially setting up such a game, one may alter game speed, money available, player slots (including AI, location, teams, etc), map, etc. Once the game is finished the only choice is to completely exit and having to set again all options manually to restart the same type of game.

It would be convenient to be able to restart the same game with the same options quickly (add a "Play again" option?), while keeping the option to reset completely and start over.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29936325-rfe-persistent-skirmish-multiplayer-game-options-and-ability-to-restart-with-said-options?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Apply some general polish to the code/yaml
data.body: You probably want to review the 3rd commit with `?w=1`: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/commit/ac70d1ed097c360c499dfc70ffe89d18c7fd40c1?w=1

data.title: Fix case mismatches in TS tileset importer.
data.body: As of #10530 the fast path for loading files requires a case sensitive match for filenames.  The filenames listed in the xcc mix databases are all in lower case.  This fixes the TS tileset definitions to use the correct case.

data.title: Index filesystem contents by filename instead of hash.
data.body:
This removes the requirement for package formats to expose classic/crc hashes to the filesystem code.  These hashes were included as a workaround for the mix format not storing filenames.  We now instead require that all mix files have corresponding mix database entries (true for all default mixes as well as any custom mixes with valid local mix database.  This will break any mods that intentionally write corrupted mix databases as "copy protection").

Tested that TD/RA/TS still run, and that they can still be installed from CD (however note #10529).

data.title: Installing from CD does not work
data.body: The installer creates the /Content directory, but not the Content/mod subdir.  It then fails because it can't find the dir to copy the files to.

data.title: Refactor Health into HitPoint
data.body:
Refactoring the `Health` trait into a `HitPoint` trait of which an actor can have multiple ones would open a whole lot of new possibilities.

To give one easy example: One element of the refactor would be to give the new trait a `Priority` and a `ImportanceType` (or similar) property. It could be used to implement StarCraft-style shields, by giving an actor two `HitPoint`s of which one gets a higher priority (targeted/damaged first as long as it's not 'destroyed'), while the other would get `ImportanceType: Critical` (`Critical` = actor dies when this point is destroyed, `Important` = actor dies when all points with this importance are destroyed, `Insignificant/Redundant` = destroying this only disables something or makes other hit points vulnerable, but has no other effect) and only if the `HP` of the latter are reduced to 0 will the actor be killed.
Of course, the trait should be upgradable, as well as able to provide upgrades.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29925927-refactor-health-into-hitpoint?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Position of Leave and Stay buttons in TD reversed compared to other mods
data.body:
In the TD mod 'Leave' is on the right, in the other mods on the left.

Personally I think TD's positioning makes more sense, as I consider 'Stay' to be the equivalent to 'Back'.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29925153-position-of-leave-and-stay-buttons-in-td-reversed-compared-to-other-mods?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Improve ProximityCapturable
data.body:
The following changes are made:
- Replaced the custom actor search with ProximityTriggers.
- Added a `Sticky` flag, which causes the ownership to not revert back to
  the original owner when the captor leaves.
- Added an option to show a range circle for the actor, either constantly
  or on selection, drawn in the colour of the current owner.
  This will be especially useful for invisible ProximityCapturables.
- Added trait documentation.

data.title: Split IPackage into IReadOnlyPackage and IReadWritePackage
data.body: Another small step towards mod-defined package parsers.  This also removes the ability to package maps as a mix file (which was the only place where we used the mix file writer).

data.title: download-error codepage 437 not supported
data.body:
(current latest debian package, running on debian jessie.)

While testing the asset download, the following error occured:

![downloadfail](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/438293/12366801/6bfaf24c-bbd5-11e5-86e6-e516dbdb09ae.gif)

Since the message always pops up _after_ successfully downloading, I would guess this error happens at the unpacking stage (is this a zip?), the error message doesn't make sense in any other context. Doing a quick search for the message, I came across something to do with [SharpZipLib library](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4600923/monotouch-icsharpcode-sharpziplib-giving-an-error).

data.title: Fix a crash if an order generator is active when a game ends.
data.body:
The UI code expects to be run from an unsynced context, and as of #10509 it asserts this requirement with an exception (via the world.OrderGenerator setter).  This leads to a crash if you have PBOG or another order generator active when the GameOver event fires and the options button click handler cancels the OG.

Repro case: Destroy your last base building while having the building placement order generator active.

data.title: Assign specific AI type to spawn
data.body:
For missions and other specific maps it could be handy to be able to assign specific AI to certain spawnpoints (e.g. Multi3 = Naval AI). 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29918417-assign-specific-ai-type-to-spawn?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove Util.GetFacing.
data.body:
This introduces WVec.Yaw and WAngle.Facing primitives, and uses them instead of Util.GetFacing.
This is another small step towards fixing our horrible facing code (which is required for proper handling of TS slopes), and is an immediate blocker to fixing #4823.
